title: Selendang (shoulder Cloth), 19th–20th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Shoulder cloth (selendang) in cream-white, dark brown, and light brown showing an all-over pattern of birds and a stylized floral motif. Chinese influence indicated by the lokcan, phoenix-like bird, in pattern. Fringed.

tombstone.epitaph:
Selendang (shoulder Cloth), 19th–20th century.Medium: silk
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1962-233-4.
